website_summaries.verdict: Basic yet spacious, and well-made considering the low price.
pros: Removable sprinkler head for two types of water flow
Easy to fill and looks great
cons: The holes on the sprinkler head are tiny, which lessens water flow
Some reports of leaks around the sprinkler head connection

customer_reviews.title: Found same item elsewhere for 1/3 the price
customer_reviews.text: Found the exact same one for $4 at a large chain that rhymes with Mall-mart, except it didn't have the flower pattern. Everything else was identical, even the spout. For the price difference, I regret not looking in person for one. Now I know.
customer_reviews.author: Filántropo Azteca

customer_reviews.title: Nice size, balanced handle, but slow pour spout
customer_reviews.text: This watering can is well priced and has a balanced handle design for comfortable carrying and pouring. The 2 gallon size is about the maximum capacity comfortable for carrying. My only complaints are that, for outdoor garden use, the spout could be a bit longer and the holes in the sprinkling head are way too small. It takes forever to empty the can. This might be good for watering small bedding plant, but not for my well established outdoor potted plants or when I am planting larger plants. I am going to try to enlarge the holes in the sprinkling head and hope that will take care of the flow problem.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Nozzle badly manufactured/designed, pours poorly
customer_reviews.text: The white shower-nozzle is assembled terribly. It's made of two parts and the joined area leaks _a lot_. It leaks enough that even holding a towel at the bottom of the nozzle to stop the leaking water from soaking my floor, the water pressure that pours out the actual nozzle and onto my plants is pitiful. I'm going to try sealing the whole thing with glue, but as-is this is mostly a device for pouring water on the floor around your plants and you'd be better off using just about anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Winner

customer_reviews.title: I received a used dirty product
customer_reviews.text: This product has an extremely small hole so if you are filling it with a hose, your hose needs to be small. However this was a used product which had dirt on it. Someone probably scraped off the dirt, leaving dark Scrappy marks. I have been trying to return this product since May, no success yet
customer_reviews.author: Munnu

customer_reviews.title: NIcely Balanced
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. The nozzle unscrews easily and the back opening makes it easy to fill. The double handles are great for balancing when watering. The nozzle holes are irregular as stated in some of the other reviews but I've had no problems watering the plants. It may cause a problem as the plastic wears down but for under $9 I can live with it and get a new 2-gallon one.
customer_reviews.author: Peapod

customer_reviews.title: I wasted my ten bucks on this one.
customer_reviews.text: The channel for water release in the spout was almost 95% plastic, leaving a tiny straw-sized opening for water to pour out. Trickle, trickle, trickle. I took off the decorative cover to the spout, but all I saw was green plastic with the tiniest of holes for water to come out. Waste of money! I have to turn it around and pour out the hole where I put the water in, Awkward. I’d love to get my money back on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Nale

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: The water comes out too slowly. Might be good if you're only watering a couple very fragile plants but if you have a lot to water you need it to go faster. I took off the sprinkler head and made bigger holes in the blue part and in the sprinkler head to make it more useable.
customer_reviews.author: Corolla Queen

customer_reviews.title: Sprinkler did not work
customer_reviews.text: I like the color but the sprinkler part was poorly made and would start with full spray and immediately go to single spray and i did not realize this for a few weeks as i was looking at flowers instead of continually watching water pouring out of sprinkler. So my flowers were always needing water til i watched the sprinkler and realized what was happening. So i removed the sprinkler head. I bought the watering can for the sprinkler so dissapointed. .
customer_reviews.author: Barbie Doll

customer_reviews.title: Great gentle watering for young plants
customer_reviews.text: The sprinkler head on this watering can is perfect! It pours water in a broadly distributed gentle spray with about forty jets. When I found how nicely it works, I ordered two more for my garden spaces that are away from home. The one drawback is that its filling hole is at the corner where the two handles in the photo meet. It doesn't fit under a bathroom tap or some hose bibs. I fill it at the bath tub or with a garden hose. (Its sprinkler head is gentler on newly started plants than the hose would be.)
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Cheap made, you'll be sorry
customer_reviews.text: This plastic, chinese watering can did not hold up. Started leaking, after only a month or two of use. You would think something so basic would hold up, at least a year. I threw my money away buying this. Don't do the same. I am looking to buy USA only.
customer_reviews.author: shinystones

customer_reviews.title: Small investment that does its job
customer_reviews.text: Large, easy to fill, sprinkle pouring mechanism, inexpensive. For the price, you probably can't do much better (though if you want a prettier can, you'll need to pay more). Just watch out not to fill it to the top and accidentally spill water out the spout as you walk outside with it. This is not hard to do, as heavy as this can get. You also might want to dump the little green plastic shavings out of the can before filling it up--but again, it's a very cheap item that does its job.
customer_reviews.author: hotshot309

customer_reviews.title: I love this watering can
customer_reviews.text: I love this watering can, I ordered two. Some of the holes were not open on the sprinkler head, but that was easily fixed with a drill. I ended up drilling about 15 more same sized holes on the sprinkler head for a faster pour and now it works perfectly. Seems sturdy, good size, and it's easy to fill and carry. I would buy more if price goes back down to about $6 (add on item).
customer_reviews.author: Christine L.

customer_reviews.title: easy to fill watering can
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this watering can because I could fill it from the back, instead of under the handle. The "back filling" ability allows me to get close to the spigot without spraying water everywhere. The can is sturdy and stayed outside all summer without any damage. There are plenty of holes on the rose, or head, of the can for a quick sprinkle of water. The can holds enough water to water many pots without being so full it is difficult to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Laurl G.

customer_reviews.title: Bad design and over priced
customer_reviews.text: Bad nozzle design. Leaks when you use the sprinkler. Already the sprinkler is slow...but if you try to make it slower , water will run down the spout all over the floor.. plus theres a hole/notch on the top of the spout where you see another single spray pouring to the right side. Very weird. Will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: TonyP

customer_reviews.title: Great USA made watering can
customer_reviews.text: Normally I purchase a watering can about every year and the same thing happens, it disappears to the back of the property where my husband has his veggies planted. I don't squawk too much because they were purchased from a department store and not that great. This one is different. When you sprinkle with it the water actually comes out the sprinkle head and not gushing out from the filling hole like the others do. I will have to keep my eye on this one for sure. I just wish I could have ordered in the orange color - would have made it easier to spot when it migrates to the back yard, LOL
customer_reviews.author: Cruzsuz

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with design
customer_reviews.text: I love the balance of this watering can when it's full, but I would like a slightly smaller showerhead. The spray is too diffused for plants in pots. My biggest problem is the size of the fill hole, which is too small. You have to remove the hose sprayer when filling the can with water to mix with liquid or granular fertilizer. It's also hard to clean out debris. If you try to blast it out with a jet spray, you end up with water all over yourself because it's so hard to direct the spray into such a small hole.
customer_reviews.author: Ososanna

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I planted some veggies and herbs in pots in my roof and don't have a way to get outside.. I just reach out my window. No hose either so I needed a way to sprinkle water vs pour a glass of water and make ditches in the dirt. The 1 gallon worked perfectly for me. Not to heavy to reach out with and perfect sprinkle. Unscrew the white part to release the water you don't use. Easy. Simple. Cheap. Got the job done!
customer_reviews.author: maureen

customer_reviews.title: Best Watering Can Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a sensibly designed watering can! The fill-hole is located above the handle, so it can easily be accessed with a hose or faucet. I like the two-handled design, too, one on top and one on the side. Water is heavy, and when the pitcher is full, the top and side handles make it easy to tip and pour water at the base of your plants.
customer_reviews.author: Forest Dweller

customer_reviews.title: quality and quick delivery
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted to say how refreshing it was to get something that I ordered on 6/21/20 and was delivered on 6/23/20, but was not expecting until 6/23-7/6/20. In other words, the commitment left them until 7/6 for delivery, but instead they got out asap. Appreciate the effort. I was not expecting it that quickly, but appreciate it! AND I needed it! I have had many watering cans in the past and I know what feels sturdy and this is it.
customer_reviews.author: GirlyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice
customer_reviews.text: It's large enough so you don't have to refill the container all the time, but the pour function is pathetic. Even after you raise the container water will still pour from the neck, and if you're not over whatever you planted everything will get wet. It's only water you say?...Well, who wants a daily floor watering or where ever you're using this container. For me it gets the job done as I water herbs sitting on my work bench, but if I used this anywhere else I'd probably return it.
customer_reviews.author: AB77

customer_reviews.title: Great for a month or so
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these about a year ago and it got a hole in it. I liked it so I bought another one in August. This one also got a hole in it but much faster. Seller refuses to replace it because it's been more than 30 days. It's actually been about 40 days. Do not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Leaks at the spout for about 5 minutes after using ...
customer_reviews.text: Leaks at the spout for about 5 minutes after using it. I have to place a bucket under the spout to catch the dripping from the water thats trapped in the spout from use.
customer_reviews.author: Tevin

customer_reviews.title: It just works - and that's saying a lot
customer_reviews.text: How hard can it be to make a basic, functional watering can? Apparently, it's too hard for many manufacturers. I've spent big bucks on metal cans, and gone way cheap on plastic cans. They ALL had issues. This just does what it's supposed to do -- water my plants without making me crazy. BTW, you will probably need to take a toothpick or ice pick and clear the holes in the dispenser. A small price to pay for a watering can that JUST WORKS.
customer_reviews.author: Flatula

customer_reviews.title: Cheap watering can
customer_reviews.text: This is worse quality than cheap Chinese made watering cans I have looked at recently. I am embarrassed and disappointed that this is American made. It works but I had to take the rain head off the spout to remove plastic shavings. The holes in the rain spout did not go the whole way through the plastic in some places. I had to enlarge the holes using a toothpick for it to be functional. I should have taken a before and after photos, but I did not. It’s large and seems to be of durable enough plastic to last a few years of cared for properly.
customer_reviews.author: klih

customer_reviews.title: Defective -  No Fill Hole
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Caribbean Blue 2-gallon size, and to my surprise there was no fill hole. Kinda hard to use without a way to fill it up. Poor quality control that they didn't catch that. I could have cut a hole, but then it would have sharp edges. Also, the plastic seemed on the thin side for a two gallon can. I requested a refund, & will be dropping it off at UPS tomorrow .
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Walker

customer_reviews.title: Without head it leaks through seams
customer_reviews.text: I got this so that I could make up larger quantities of water with H2O2. And I use it to refill a smaller container. So I didn't need the shower head. Without the shower head, it leaks through the seams in the threaded portion of the spout. It doesn't make me think it's well made. And it now has duct tape wound around the threads to keep it from leaking. Not exactly what I had wanted. On the other hand, it carries a lot of water (for now.)
customer_reviews.author: AHK

customer_reviews.title: Stout. Good handle.
customer_reviews.text: As the title states. It's well made (Good quality plastic) and the handle is pretty comfortable. Balances well so you can single grip it. Good for the price. Pours very well, obviously. (The design is well done.)
customer_reviews.author: Pirate_Joke

customer_reviews.title: shower your garden with love
customer_reviews.text: It was surprisingly difficult to find a watering can with holes that actually shower your plants instead of big heavy, seed-dislodging globs of water the head of this can has perfect little holes that allow the water to flow delicately onto your babies. It does not feel particularly ergonomic and can be awkward to hold, but is the best i have found for these features.
customer_reviews.author: missniche

customer_reviews.title: Slow pouring, better for garden than terrace
customer_reviews.text: The head of this watering can does not allow for enough water to go out at the same time. Also, the spread is a little too wide. I use it for my plants in the terrace and sometimes water gets spilled out of the pot just because of the radius. I think this is great for a garden, not so much for potted flowers.
customer_reviews.author: Giacomo Bossa

customer_reviews.title: Like it !
customer_reviews.text: Light, cute, well made, good fit for my purpose. I like the design and size which Is easy to refill, handle and carry. One gallon is good size for using indoor or outdoor.
customer_reviews.author: LLA

customer_reviews.title: It does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an identical one that has been used for at least ten years for birdbath cleaning. For sometime, it’s had leaks so finally got a new one. Some have complained that they received a new one that had arrived with leaks but mine is just fine-no leaks.
customer_reviews.author: tjmadison

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Have owned the one gallon version for 3.5 years and use it for apartment gardening. Just the right size combination for water but small enough to store out of the way. The distributing white ‘nozzle’ is removable which is great for washing down surfaces or watering a holiday tree!
customer_reviews.author: Steve O

customer_reviews.title: what i needed
customer_reviews.text: a container that held enough water to suit all my plants. the two handles are great when it is full and as it empties and gets lighter, i just use the one. great idea. i fill them (have 2) each afternoon for the next day's watering that way they can "off gas" some of the chlorine and give the plants a healthier drink. i am satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: totally at peace

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and waters well
customer_reviews.text: I use to water hanging baskets and patio plants. Because of physical reasons, I take my baskets down to water. The watering can holds more than enough water for both watering and “rinsing” foliage. I also use it on patio plants and again, it works well. I like the shower effect it has. You do need some space between pots for watering, as it is a nice size.
customer_reviews.author: Eudora

customer_reviews.title: Good watering can
customer_reviews.text: Watering cans were another odd product that we couldn't find locally due to everyone staying home during the pandemic. This watering can fit the bill: it arrived quickly and is of good quality. The handle is very good, but the fill hole is smaller because of it. You can screw the diffuser off the spout for faster emptying options. We're happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: EJ Honda

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I saw some reviews that the holes weren’t made all the way through but it’s really not an issue if you have a pin or small nail to complete the holes. Mine was able to get most of the water out of the holes but there were a few that weren’t all the way made. Other than that it’s a great watering can.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Spencer

customer_reviews.title: since then this can has worked great and i havent had any issues with it
customer_reviews.text: the only problem i had with this watering can was that water leaked from where the white nozzle connects to the green can, and spills quite a bit of water. the white nozzle unscrews from the rest of the can so i took it off and put superglue around where it screws on at and then put it back on to make a seal, since then this can has worked great and i havent had any issues with it leaking

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: We have some potted plants out on our front porch and back patio, so I ordered 2. I LOVE that they were made in the USA. They are sturdy and easy to hold. We are VERY happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jude

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This adorable watering can was exactly what I needed and I highly recommend it!!! I love the double handles--one is perfect for carrying and the other for pouring (makes it easy on my arthritic hands)! It's well-made and seems like it will last a long time, but I would order another in a heartbeat! A cute little frog has made it his home recently and he gives it 5-stars too!
customer_reviews.author: leiluni

customer_reviews.title: Easy  to  use.
customer_reviews.text: Product well made and easy to handle. Spout works well at watering delicate flowers. Made of plastic so will not rust. Would recommend for simple watering.
customer_reviews.author: G Flye

customer_reviews.title: Easy to fill and use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this partially because the fill hole is unobstructed by the handle like many other watering cans, so I can fill it very easily in the sink. I've grown to really appreciate the back handle, which makes it so easy and ergonomic to water plants with a full watering can while the top handle makes it easy to carry. Very well designed! There is a slight leak from behind the nozzle, but it doesn't really bother me.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Simple and lightweight, yellow color pops!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as it looks! Simple, lightweight, molded plastic watering can. It's obvious that the item isn't completely "finished" smooth after the molding process because there are some very small particles of plastic peeling off the edges around the opening, though nothing that affected the item's utility whatsoever. Also, as other have commented, there was one hole in the white spout that wasn't fully punctured, but a metal skewer quickly finished the job. The yellow color pops nicely, but I noticed a couple very very faint red/green stain lines on the outside of the can which are almost completely unnoticeable unless you get really up close and inspect it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great Watering Can!
customer_reviews.text: I use this item at least 3-4 times a week, and I have never experienced any issues. It doesn't leak at all! The size is perfect too, I only fill it up once to water my plants! The top or spout comes off, so If you don't fee like to using the sprinkler/top you can just easily remove it. The color is nice and the design is cute! I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: GraceV

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: 1/4 of the holes for watering had been mis-stamped so it didn't work well. Real cheap quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Scheidt

customer_reviews.title: Most cost effective watering can there is
customer_reviews.text: Bought this watering can for use with outdoor plants. It has been perfect for our needs! Not too big so it isn't heavy and gets the job done very well. I really like the two handles as well and the color is perfect! Hoping it lasts a long time because it was the best option for the money by far.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor D.

customer_reviews.title: Just Got It & Love It! Plumber's Tape for the Win!
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived with a leaking issue at the rose connection, like others have mentioned. No amount of tightening would fix it and I didn't want to break the rose so I grabbed my plumber's tape and wrapped away. I tested afterward and as I had hoped, problem solved. Great watering can for what it is. Two handles will help a lot and the stream through the rose is quite good and spread out nicely. Can't wait to use it. Now if the weather would only cooperate.
customer_reviews.author: don't you wish you knew

customer_reviews.title: People at this place don't know the difference between 1 and 2 gallon cans
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a 2 gallon can, was sent a can that was 1 gallon. The sticker said 2 gallon. Too much trouble to return as it seems the people can't tell the difference between a 1 and 2 gallon watering can. The end piece seems cheaply made and won't last a season. It'll do the job but it will take longer as this is just a 1 gallon can.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi A.

customer_reviews.title: Great looking and well engineered can that works well.
customer_reviews.text: The can is a nice size, and the fill hole is positioned behind the handle, instead of under it. That makes a surprising improvement on other designs. While being light the can is sturdy and its color is nice. The sprinkler detaches and reattaches easily and produces a good pattern when in use. I'm only slightly disappointed in the price, which could have been a bit lower.
customer_reviews.author: RobertTop Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: Leaks like crazy out of showerhead
customer_reviews.text: If you don't care about the showerhead and throw that part away, this holds water and pours. However, with the shower head on, about 1/3 water leaks around edges, another 1/3 dribbles out the bottom few holes, and only a 1/3 goes where you're aiming. Floors always wet, this thing is comically bad. I mean... I just wanted a watering can, how hard can it be!?
customer_reviews.author: Frequent shopper

customer_reviews.title: Holds a good amount of water
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to fill and holds the water well, no leaks and doesn't add much weight to the volume of water. The spout end unscrews if you need a better pour to get to the soil and not wet the plant leaves. I like the sage color. Took awhile to receive, but otherwise it is just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: CBaz

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: Received the item in a box that was falling apart. The watering can was completely smashed. However, after seeing the quality of the can, I returned it and did not reorder. Definitely cheap plastic, the hole at the top was small and awkward to fill with water. Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Joycie1209

customer_reviews.title: too few holes and not ergonomical
customer_reviews.text: The holes are very few and small. I had to poke quite a few holes, so I could water without frustration (and wanting to pull out the head for easier watering). to water - a) if I hold the top handle, I'd need to twist my wrist to get water out, b) if I hold the side handle, water could spill from the top filling hole, c) holding both handles can work... but I wish it's designed better.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia L.

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect but functional
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice size and it's functional, but the spout isn't as good as it should be. The white spout doesn't seal completely, so water leaks out of the seam when pouring. The spout pours well, but not necessarily straight; the water tends to spout off different directions randomly. It's not perfect, but for under $10, it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: A. Purcell

customer_reviews.title: Unreasonably expensive
customer_reviews.text: $15 for a watering can seems decent enough, however, they get you with the $9 shipping costs. There are plenty of nice watering cans at Walmart etc. I bought one for $2-3 there. Please don’t waste your time buying this expensive, basically $25 watering can. (I returned this product and am getting less than half of my money back!)
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ahlgren

customer_reviews.title: Award-Winning Watering Can.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this watering can for six months now. It works as expected. Haven't had a single issue with it yet. I use it to water the plants on my balcony and it gets that simple task completed perfectly. Five stars because it was also cheaper than other watering cans on Amazon and Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: SleepyTimeMD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size!
customer_reviews.text: I unscrewed the plastic tip for faster watering of my tomatoe plants. So far so good! It doesn't leak when I have the tip on it and the slightly smaller size makes it easier to handle when filled all the way up. Beware though if you are absentminded like I am and leave it in your sink with the water turned on while filling. I came back to a flooded kitchen! When full, the water will start to shoot out of the nozzle (and onto the floor if pointed that direction). Not anyone's fault but my own, so it still deserves 5 stars but I thought I'd share my newly gleaned wisdom with other buyers. 😊
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to wrangle
customer_reviews.text: When completely full, the handles aren't quite designed to keep the spout upright while you're transferring it from hose to plants. Will probably water your patio floor a bit. Of course, 2 gallons is a lot of water, so you really don't need to fill it up the whole way.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy little watering can
customer_reviews.text: Nice watering can. I love the rear fill hole rather than having the fill hole under the handle. The back loop handle is very handy when the can is almost empty so that you don't have to twist your wrist to get all the water out. The plastic is sturdy and doesn't deform when you carry a full can. Excess leakage is minimal after pouring. This was my biggest complaint in my old can--it would dribble a lot of water after a pour.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie A. Clark

customer_reviews.title: built enough so it can be easily hauled around the yard
customer_reviews.text: Watering can is, "heavy duty", built enough so it can be easily hauled around the yard, garden, etc. and does not tip over easily. The watering spout sprinkles the water around really well so all the water does not all come out gushing in one place on your plants. Yea...its going to last more than one season in the garden.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well balanced watering can
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for the same watering can that finally sprung a leak after 15 years. This one may be a little less robust but only time will tell. It is well balanced when full and I appreciate the two handles. The holes on the spout provide good flow.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Powers

customer_reviews.title: Tip me over and pour
customer_reviews.text: Some of the spout holes weren’t fully open but a toothpick helped unclogged them. Good steady flow of water. Easy to fill up. I like the 2 handles; makes for easy pouring at different angles. It’s been sitting outside but I won’t know how durable it is until it stops raining and it sits in the sun for a couple months. But so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Melly B

customer_reviews.title: You want this watering can.
customer_reviews.text: I've seen some comments about this watering can pouring very slowly. Here is my response: Other than a factory defect someone may experience, this product pours perfectly. The reason you want this watering can is because you don't want the pressure and full force of a garden hose. Not only that but a 2 gallon capacity watering can is better than a 1 gallon...or less. This watering can is perfect for the seeds that haven't yet broken the surface, the sprouts that cannot yet withstand water pressure and the well established potted plants. It is good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great until the spout cover broke
customer_reviews.text: This waterer worked great for two years. I made the mistake of leaving out out all winter and all summer in the sun. The white plastic spot cover became brittle and broke
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Cady

customer_reviews.title: A slow, wide pour
customer_reviews.text: I got this to match a similar watering can that I bought from a dollar store. Compared to the dollar store product, this one is the same size, 3 times the cost, pours at about half the speed, and covers a wider area. Sometimes I like the slower, wider pour, especially if watering the tops of the plants- it won't crush the plants with the water. However, if you intend to water at the roots you may find this to be too slow and widely dispersed.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Wiemer

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturing defect
customer_reviews.text: The watering can arrvied quickly but is unusable. It has a manufacturing defect where a portion of the plastic on the bottom of the can is so thin it would either immediately break if I filled it with water or it would fail very quickly after we started using it. The picture shows the defective, very thin plastic. I don't know what quality control process there are but this can should have never been shipped.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer #98

customer_reviews.title: Easy to fill and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I love this watering can. The hole is on top at the back, not under the handle, so its easy to fill. I've been using it for two weeks and it feels very durable. The color is bright and easy to find and I might need to get another one for the vegetable garden.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi from CA

customer_reviews.title: She drips from spout, hard to fill, will fight you when it's full
customer_reviews.text: The fill hole is small. When done watering it drips from the spout for a while. I have to park it above the sink so it doesn't drip on the counter. When full it is difficult to tip it over one handed to get the water out.
customer_reviews.author: From the mind of Bob

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Lightweight Watering Can
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy I ordered this watering can. It can be used two ways: hold from the handle and let the water sprinkle out or turn around the can and hold onto handle again and use open ended area to let water come out quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Cannavo

customer_reviews.title: Way better then any of the options available at HD
customer_reviews.text: Way better then any of the options available at HD. Competitive price. This looks exactly like my pops watering can from 20 years ago. It works perfectly. It's great that there are handles on the back and top for control when watering.
customer_reviews.author: LaLaSa

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and I like that the whole is at the back rather than in the middle. It is easier to put water in and you can take out and put back in the shower head. About the shower head, some water stays in it and continues leaking after use. I find it annoying because I don't have a yard, I use it to water my plants in my apartment and the floor gets wet every time.
customer_reviews.author: Galia

customer_reviews.title: Made in USA
customer_reviews.text: We've had a lot of plastic watering cans. This one is sturdy and intelligently designed, and as others have pointed out, the flow from the head is gentle, good for seedlings. It seems heavier than less expensive cans.
customer_reviews.author: W Olson

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. Made of thick, sturdy plastic. Can is easy to hold and pour. I love I can remove the nozzle. It makes pouring water to the base of the plants easy. Excellent price. Excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: L.Lovelace

customer_reviews.title: great price, works fine
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this for outdoor gardening in FL. Seemed to be the lowest price on amazon for watering cans. Arrived quickly. I'd say 2 gallons is the largest people could comfortably use - I wouldn't go larger. Works OK, but dribbles on the bottom of the spout a little bit. I went with the 3-set ... arrived pretty quickly, in 2 packages. It's got a small input area, but I suppose that's good for not leaking. If for some reason you need to clean it out, though, that would be difficult. I leave mine outside, and the other cans I've had eventually had leaves and such fall into them.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Borkosky

customer_reviews.title: Perfect THANK YOU
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect thank you it's thick and durable, I've left it outside tons of times nothing happened to it I like the amount of water that it holds the way that it Waters thank you I love this thing it's perfect five stars all the way
customer_reviews.author: Amelia B.

customer_reviews.title: Started leaking. Very poor quality and support number disconnected
customer_reviews.text: Started leaking after a couple of years. Very poor quality and support number disconnected. Awkward to use and poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: I was looking for a nice watering can
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a nice watering can. I originally thought I would get a metal one, however the reviews for this were too good to not try it. I really like this can. I like that this one is easy to carry when full of water because it is plastic. I feel like a metal can, full of water would have been very difficult to carry. I personally also like this can because it has two handles. My daughter likes to "help" water the plants and vegetables and the two handles give room for each of our hands. I would recommend this to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Goat

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: This appears to be the exact same item that was sold at Wal-mart for $10. Even the same design on the side. Wish I would have checked that first. I was hoping for something of higher quality. It works, but I’m doubtful it will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: M. A. Chapell

customer_reviews.title: Works great, nice flow from the sprinkler, easy to hold, love the purple color!
customer_reviews.text: This is so cute, it's almost like a yard decoration, I leave it out on my front porch! It works great, the flow from the sprinkler head is very nice, not too fast, works great on my potted plants. And it is easy to hold and maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine S. Guenaga

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, ergonomic watering can.
customer_reviews.text: This can is lightweight and easy to hold with my arthritic wrists. The only drawback is that the filling hole at the top of the can is a little too small to fill without splashing water outside of the can.
customer_reviews.author: MMC

customer_reviews.title: Super cute, the spout is perfect
customer_reviews.text: Super cute, the spout is perfect, has just the right amount of holes, holding the can in one spot covers the plant as though it's being rained completely on, the circumference of the pour is generous, and it pours gently. When the can is full the handle is very helpful to assist, plus it holds enough water to make your watering more efficient without having to fill up several times. I can't imagine a better watering can!
customer_reviews.author: ruby rox

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: This holds a lot of water. I was hating running back and forth refilling my pitcher to water the plants on my porch. This holds enough water for the whole patio, and I usually have some left over for next time.
customer_reviews.author: Faith H.

customer_reviews.title: Watering can
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and the two handles make it easy to hold and pour. The problem is the nozzle leaks just enough to be annoying
customer_reviews.author: tracy wilson

customer_reviews.title: Bad rosette quality
customer_reviews.text: This watering can has a good feel to it. I like the handles and the location of the hole to fill it is very convenient. However, the rosette mine came with is very poorly made. Half of the holes were not punched all the way through, and some of the holes that were are at strange angles. The seal between the rosette and the spout is also bad.
customer_reviews.author: liz

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: So much better than filling a pot or bowl with water, trying to balance it without spilling while opening doors to go outside to water my flowers! This watering can holds a lot of water, and the spray is very gentle. No leaks anywhere. It's a bit heavy when full, so my hold on it is a bit awkward at first, but gets better as I water. Saved me a trip to the store (wearing my face mask) to try to find one.
customer_reviews.author: Emeli

customer_reviews.title: good water can
customer_reviews.text: this is a good water can, the best style and design heavy enough, removable spout is good to have although I had to take a small scribe and open up the holes a little in spout some were closed off but works good
customer_reviews.author: BAO89

customer_reviews.title: Buy it for the convenience of being delivered
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok not so sure I would buy it again probably same or cheaper somewhere else. It’s convenient not having to go out to get it this is it. But it if anything for the convenience of being delivered
customer_reviews.author: Hue lover

customer_reviews.title: I love this watering can!
customer_reviews.text: It's quite adorable and holds a lot more than it looks: a whole two gallons! Previously I had been using water bottles to water all my plants so this was a major step up. I love the two different sets of handles, makes it easy to carry and water plants with just one hand instead of needing both. The nozzle does leak for a couple of seconds after bringing it upright right after watering so I'd be careful when watering indoor plants because it could leak on the floor but it's really a small price to pay for this great lil' thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: watering Can
customer_reviews.text: Really good watering can. I had one years ago that just broke down, same kind as this one . Had to part with it Lightweight, easy pouring. Deliver was good and color was as expected
customer_reviews.author: marylene

customer_reviews.title: could be better
customer_reviews.text: For the price I could not expect top quality, but it could have been a little better made. It hold water well. With the whole where it is it is a good idea to fill it either with a hose or in the tub almost got it stuck in my kitchen sink. Also wish they would have made a little more effort when making, the spray comes out of my can unevenly and makes a bit of a mess because they didn't take the time to make sure all of the hole were opened in the plastic half of then are only indents and not actual holes.
customer_reviews.author: Tekeishab

customer_reviews.title: I have enjoyed the double handle
customer_reviews.text: this is the second season for this watering can. I have enjoyed the double handle. The oval shape aids in caring it at your side. When you pour the stream is easy to control. The nozzle works well for new plantings, but I remove it later for faster watering. Will buy again but this can is holding up extremely well so I don't know when that will be.
customer_reviews.author: farm gal

customer_reviews.title: Very useful watering can
customer_reviews.text: I love this watering can. It sprinkles evenly and slowly so it’s great when you’re watering delicate potted plants or sprinkling with a foliar fertilizer. I like the dual handles which is helpful depending on how much water is in the can and the angle of sprinkling.
customer_reviews.author: Meh

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to use watering can
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent watering can! It's easy to fill, large enough to use throughout the yard on several plants and the sprinkler head is great for applying water or food mixes directly to roots/soil.
customer_reviews.author: Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: These are inexpensive enough that you can buy more than one. That way, one can be filling at the faucet while you empty the other one. I did laugh though when the offer for a 2 year warranty popped up when I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Sedro

customer_reviews.title: Keep your patience, and sense of humor.
customer_reviews.text: I had to hunt a bit, before I found this; but keep your sense-of-they’re not easy to access, for some mysterious reason. And then you get one and a few more follow. Its’s not a real problem, since Amazon has a great return/refund policy.
customer_reviews.author: MaryAnn L.

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes basic is all you need.
customer_reviews.text: I actually use this watering can to rinse the walls of my shower when I am cleaning it. It is easy to fill. Even in a bathroom sink! The can is very light even when completely full of water. I wish the holes were a bit bigger and more uniform, so more water came out at once. But that's just me being picky. I mean really, what do you want for the price? Does what it's meant to do for cheap. If my review was helpful to you, please mark it as helpful below. :)
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels love it.
customer_reviews.text: The detachable tip is a favorite toy of the little tree rats in our area. It seems like they want to play soccer with it after the knock the tank over and remove the sprinkler.
customer_reviews.author: A. Tyner

customer_reviews.title: Different and better
customer_reviews.text: Different from any other watering can I've had. At first, I thought, "Oh, no!" because you fill it from the back from a rather small hole. Then when I used it, it worked so much better--I'm really impressed with the design. The top handle makes it easy to carry, and the back handle makes it easy to tip for watering. Using both makes it easy to regulate how fast the water sprinkles. It's not as easy for me to haul heavy things around as it was a decade or two ago, but the design of this can certainly makes it better. I'm impressed, I really am.
customer_reviews.author: Anne L. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Works Just Fine!
customer_reviews.text: Well - I was hoping and planning to get a metal/tin painted watering can but they were sold out and not likely to be available for a while so I went with this one for FUNCTION. It's just about all I could actually pick up when full, and it works just FINE! I like that the sprinkler spout unscrews and you can use the narrow spout if you just want to get at the plant roots. I got the dark green so I can leave it out in the garden (when I'm feeling lazy) and it won't compete visually with the plants. All in all, very acceptable. I would recommend. And the price was good, too!.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gjeny

customer_reviews.title: Leaks around the head
customer_reviews.text: Leaks around the head it’s a design flaw or bad product but it’s not fixable. This does not bother me since the water is going where I want it to but your paying for a product to work as intended that doesn’t.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weird Handles
customer_reviews.text: It's quite difficult to hold and carry the way the two handles are placed. Also, difficult to fill with water: small opening in addition to one the handles being in the way
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Union 63068 Watering Can with Tulip Design, 2 Gallon, Sage Green
product_meta.description: Size:2 gallon| Color:Sage GreenThis classic Union Products blow-mold plastic garden accessory is still proudly made in the United States and features a replaceable screw on sprinkler head and tulip design on the sides. Watering Can stands 13 inches tall, 17 inches long, and holds 2 gallons of water. Made in the USA.
feature_bullets: Holds 2 Gallons and Has 1.5 Inch Opening

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,601 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
